Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2009 07:51PM miadora wrote: Hi mimi - I shouldn't have gone back to work the next day. I work about 20 miles from my home, so once I got there, I figured it was too far to drive home. I felt lousy, looked worse, and by the time the day was over, I felt like I was going to faint. Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2009 06:41PM miadora wrote: Sorry I didn't see your post, and that there wasn't a response.  My bruising was on the outside, right near the incision. I am about 4 weeks into this, and asked my regular MD about when I could expect the annoying ache will go away. ( Pain lessened each day, by the way.) She said that this area is rich in nerve endings, so it will take a bit longer  to feel 'normal'. A few more weeks. I switched to heat after the 2nd day, because it felt better.  The bruising dimished after 3-4 days, only a light purple/brown.  I think that any time you have concerns or questions, it is not unreasonable to call the surgeon. Also- my bandage was removed by the surgeon a week after the biopsy.  It felt better when it was on.  I hope that you are feeling better, and that the result of the biopsy was good.  -A  PS- Last week was the first time I could actually lay on my stomach for a nap. My cats still aren't allowed to lounge on my chest, anywhere near my left breast. I watch them carefully for signs that they will leap up to snuggle.
